newsitem.title: LUXEMBOURG: Sweden urges EU to improve farm animal transport.
newsitem.headline: Sweden urges EU to improve farm animal transport.

text.p: Sweden on Tuesday urged the European Union to stop granting subsidies for exporting live cattle unless animal welfare conditions were improved.
"We are upset that not enough is being in the EU to get away from the terrible trade in animals," Swedish Farm Minister Annika Ahnberg told a news briefing during an EU Farm Council.

In response, EU Farm Commissioner Franz Fischler said that the Commission would soon present a proposal linking export refunds to animal welfare. The Commission was also checking that member states were enforcing existing animal welfare rules.
Fischler said he hoped that farm ministers would decide next month on a proposal on animal resting stations during long journeys.
The Commission would present a proposal on cattle truck standards soon, he added.
